org.knime.base.node.preproc.pmml.missingval.handlers.timeseries

Class LinearInterpolationStatisticTB

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.base.data.statistics.Statistic
      • org.knime.base.node.preproc.pmml.missingval.handlers.timeseries.MappingStatistic
        • org.knime.base.node.preproc.pmml.missingval.handlers.timeseries.MappingTableInterpolationStatistic
          • org.knime.base.node.preproc.pmml.missingval.handlers.timeseries.LinearInterpolationStatisticTB
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<DataCell>

    public class LinearInterpolationStatisticTB
extends MappingTableInterpolationStatistic
    Table based statistic that calculates for each missing cell the linear interpolation between the previous and next valid cell.
    Author:
    Alexander Fillbrunn

    • Method Detail

      • consumeRow

        protected void consumeRow(DataRow dataRow)
        Called for each row in the data table. Implementations should loop over the Statistic.getIndices() array, to receive the DataCells of interest. Be aware that the data cell could also be the missing cell. An example is shown below. 
         protected void consumeRow(final DataRow dataRow) {
     for (int i : getIndices()) {
         DataCell cell = dataRow.getCell(i);
         //... do computation
     }
 }
        Specified by:
        consumeRow in class Statistic
        Parameters:
        dataRow - the data points
